conclusion: To solve the problem, we need to determine the time t_1 it takes for the wooden rod to pass through the upper end A of the cylinder. We will use the equations of motion under free fall.
The distance the top of the rod needs to fall to reach the top of the cylinder is 20 m.

premise: Using the equation of motion s = (1/2) g t^2, where s is the distance and g is the acceleration due to gravity.
conclusion: 20 = (1/2) x 10 x t_1'^2 implies 20 = 5 t_1'^2 implies t_1'^2 = 4 implies t_1' = 2 s
The distance the bottom of the rod needs to fall to reach the top of the cylinder is 25 m (since the rod is 5 m long and the distance to the top of the cylinder is 20 m).

premise: Using the same equation of motion s = (1/2) g t^2.
conclusion: 25 = (1/2) x 10 x t_2'^2 implies 25 = 5 t_2'^2 implies t_2'^2 = 5 implies t_2' = sqrt(5) s

premise: The time t_1 is the difference between the time it takes for the bottom of the rod to reach the top of the cylinder and the time it takes for the top of the rod to reach the top of the cylinder.
